greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(phi(k), k-1) / lambda(k), where k is n-th Carmichael number A002997(n) and lambda(k) = A002322(k).
mathematica: t = Cases[Range[1, 16 (10^6), 2], n_ /; Mod[n, CarmichaelLambda@ n] == 1 && ! PrimeQ@ n]; Table[GCD[EulerPhi@ t[[n]], t[[n]] - 1]/CarmichaelLambda@ t[[n]], {n, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 03 2015, after _Artur Jasinski_ at A002997: alternatively use A002997 data for t *)
results.author: _Thomas Ordowski_, Nov 01 2015
